decoworld.model.world.entities.combat

Class CombatEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.entities.WorldEntity
      • decoworld.model.world.entities.combat.StatEntity
        • decoworld.model.world.entities.combat.CombatEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasCombat, HasHealth, HasStats, StatListener, HasLevel, HasLocation, HasRotation, WorldItem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmmoCrate, Arrow, Crate, GenericMobSprite, HealthPack, Player, PlayerPet, Yralemounts, Zombiemounts

    public class CombatEntity
extends StatEntity
implements HasCombat, HasLevel
    CombatEntity provides a generic implementation for a WorldItem that inherits the HasCombat interface.

    • Method Detail

      • getHealth

        public double getHealth()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns the percentage of remaining health, where a value of 1.0 represents getMaxHealth(). Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. To calculate the remaining health as a value: remainingHealth = getHealth() * getMaxHealth() Note: Percentages above 1.0 are valid and represent a temporary health boost above getMaxHealth()
        Specified by:
        getHealth in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        percentage - the percentage of remaining health

      • getMaxHealth

        public double getMaxHealth()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns the maximum health. Must be greater than 0. Note: It is possible to go over the maximum health when getHealth() returns a value greater than 1.0. This case represents a temporary health boost.
        Specified by:
        getMaxHealth in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        maxHealth - the "maximum" health

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(double percentage)
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Sets the percentage of remaining health irrespective of any defense or healing bonuses. Sets the percentage of remaining health (see getHealth()) without taking defense or healing bonuses into account. Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. Do not use this method to damage or heal the object. Instead, implement the HasCombat interface and use a HealthEffect.
        Specified by:
        setHealth in interface HasHealth
        Parameters:
        percentage - - the percentage of remaining health

      • onStatEvent

        public void onStatEvent(StatEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: StatListener
        Called when a StatEvent occurs in a HasStats object that we are listening to.
        Specified by:
        onStatEvent in interface StatListener
        Overrides:
        onStatEvent in class StatEntity
        Parameters:
        event - - the stat event

      • applyEffect

        public boolean applyEffect(StatEffect effect)
        Description copied from interface: HasStats
        Applies an effect to any applicable statistics. Objects that implement this interface should generally pass this effect to all statistics and let the statistic implementation determine whether it should handle the effect or not. The effect.getType() method may not be sufficient to determine which statistics can handle it.
        Specified by:
        applyEffect in interface HasStats
        Overrides:
        applyEffect in class StatEntity
        Parameters:
        effect - - the effect to apply
        Returns:
        successful - true iff the effect was applied.

      • applyEffect

        public void applyEffect(HealthEffect effect)
        Description copied from interface: HasCombat
        Apply a health effect. Defense and healing bonuses are taken into account.
        Specified by:
        applyEffect in interface HasCombat
        Parameters:
        effect - - the HealthEffect object

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns true if the object is in a dead state (usually corresponding to when getHealth is equal to zero). Otherwise returns false.
        Specified by:
        isDead in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        boolean - whether the object is dead
